# Runa (HR software)

| headquarters = Mexico City, Mexico
}}
Runa is a cloud-based HR and payroll platform designed for small and medium-sized businesses in Latin America. It was founded by Courtney McColgan in 2017 and is headquartered in Mexico City, Mexico.
History
Courtney McColgan, Former CMO of Cabify, founded Runa in October 2017, then officially launched the platform after three months of development through the Y Combinator accelerator program.
The cloud-based SaaS platform provides features such as automated payroll, IMSS (social security) and human resources management, and report generation. The platform also integrates employee benefits, such as medical, dental, and life insurance.Payroll receipts can be issued with CFDI 4.0 stamping to comply with SAT requirements.
In 2020, Runa opened offices in Monterrey.
In 2021, McColgan announced plans for Runa to expand into Brazil. In 2025, the company expanded to Chile, Peru, and Colombia.
LinkedIn named Runa one of the best startups to work for in Mexico. Runa also publishes a research report known as the Mexico Salary Guide.
